Reunited after being separated for over six decades,...
...South Koreans have crossed the border with the North to meet with family members.
The Korean War in the early 1950s divided the country...
...between a communist North and capitalist South.
...unable to contact each other even by phone.
The reunion waiting list has thousands of names.
These are the lucky few, selected through a lottery.
After just a few days, the elderly, sad Koreans say tearful goodbyes.
...will be the last time they'll ever see their separated loved ones.
